    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
The highly anticipated El Clásico clash between Real Madrid and Barcelona at the Santiago Bernabéu Stadium turned out to be a thrilling encounter packed with high-quality football, controversial moments, twists, and turns. Real Madrid hosted their arch-rivals Barcelona, looking to gain an edge in La Liga's title race. The match ended with Barcelona emerging victorious with a 3-2 triumph over their eternal rivals in a game that will be remembered for its non-stop action and dramatic moments. 

The game commenced with Real Madrid taking the kick-off. Within the first few seconds, the action was swift, and the ball was out of play several times as both teams tried to settle into their rhythm. Early throw-ins and clearances dominated the opening minutes, indicating a high-pressing and intense start from both sides. 

Real Madrid got the first notable opportunity in the 5th minute with a shot on target, setting the tone early and testing Barcelona’s defense. However, frantic attacking attempts saw multiple offside decisions sway against both teams as their forwards sought to exploit spaces behind the defenses. Real Madrid’s Cristiano Ronaldo and Barcelona’s Luis Suarez faced early frustrations from the assistant referee’s flag. 

Barcelona crafted their first significant chance around the 10th minute when Luis Suarez unleashed a shot from some 20 meters out, only to see it narrowly miss the left post. Real Madrid’s defense had to stay vigilant as their opponents showed their intent early on. 

Real Madrid’s Casemiro found himself in the referee Alejandro Hernandez’s book by the 12th minute. The Brazilian midfielder was shown a yellow card for a late challenge, an early indication of the physicality expected in this fierce rivalry. Moments later, Real Madrid had to regroup, realizing that maintaining composure was necessary to avoid further disciplinary issues.

Real Madrid soon launched another offensive, with Karim Benzema and Ronaldo actively involved. Benzema’s attempts to send a low pass into the penalty area and Ronaldo’s efforts were well-handled by Barcelona's defense and custodian, Marc-Andre ter Stegen. Ter Stegen’s impressive saves, especially against Ronaldo’s powerful strikes, kept Barcelona in the game during the first half.

The dynamic flow of the game saw Marcelo and Gareth Bale (substituted by Marco Asensio later due to injury) repeatedly testing Barcelona’s backline. Near the 18th-minute mark, Benzema’s beautiful mid-range volley was thwarted by ter Stegen, epitomizing Madrid’s persistent but futile efforts in breaking the deadlock.

In the 27th minute, Real Madrid’s attacking persistence paid off. From a corner taken by Toni Kroos, Sergio Ramos gathered the cross inside the box and struck the ball. Though his shot only hit the right-hand post, Casemiro was in the right place to capitalize on the rebound. He rifled the ball low inside the left post, granting Real Madrid the lead with a scoreline of 1-0. The Santiago Bernabéu erupted in cheers as their team edged ahead.

However, their lead was short-lived. Barcelona responded swiftly in the 32nd minute when Ivan Rakitic showcased great vision, sending a pass to Lionel Messi. Messi, demonstrating his trademark composure, slotted the ball into the bottom right corner, leveling the match at 1-1. The game was well and truly on.

In the subsequent phases, Real Madrid saw numerous opportunities to regain their lead. Luka Modric and Marco Asensio’s efforts on goal were spectacularly saved by ter Stegen. Meanwhile, Barcelona coordinated their gameplay with a series of short passes, seeking to breach Madrid’s defense.

The half drew to a close with a dramatic spell. In the 38th minute, Barcelona’s Samuel Umtiti received a yellow card for a harsh tackle. Real Madrid then faced a blow when Gareth Bale had to make way due to injury, summoning Marco Asensio earlier than anticipated. Despite coordinated team efforts, nothing separated the teams as the first half ended at 1-1.

The second half began with Barcelona’s kickoff. Madrid started strong, earning an early corner just 60 seconds in. Toni Kroos produced a ferocious strike from the edge of the box; however, it was astutely stopped by ter Stegen, who continued his stellar performance.

Barcelona’s determination translated into a goal around the 27th minute of the second half. Ivan Rakitic capitalized on a loose ball outside the box and fired a brilliant shot inside the left post. His strike was beyond the reach of Keylor Navas, propelling Barcelona into a 2-1 lead.

The game saw another wave of action when Sergio Ramos received a red card in the 31st minute for making a horrific tackle. This card represented a significant setback for Real Madrid, leaving them with ten men to chase the game.

However, Real Madrid displayed remarkable determination. In the 40th minute of the second half, Marcelo’s lofted cross found James Rodriguez, who, with a precise touch, finished with a quick shot into the top left corner, bringing the score to 2-2. The match was poised thrillingly with just minutes to go.

Just when it seemed the points would be shared, Barcelona conjured one final moment of magic. In the last minute of added time, Jordi Alba laid the ball for Messi, who, shooting from close range, found the left side of the goal, leaving Navas helpless. This clinching goal secured a dramatic 3-2 victory for Barcelona.

The match’s intensity didn’t end with the final whistle. Messi himself saw a rare booking for his celebrations, but Barcelona’s elation was clear – they had triumphed in a classic battle against their arch-rivals in Real Madrid’s own fortress. The game was filled with immense talent on display, spirited sequences, and dramatic interventions, treating fans worldwide to a truly memorable El Clásico.
